alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 1:24PM MDT until August 17 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Garfield County in southern Utah... Southwestern Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 415 PM MDT. * At 124 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Capitol Reef National Park. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen, with the highest rainfall amounts over Sulphur Creek and Grand Wash. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyons. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park, Torrey and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
